info.name: Death Knight
info.description: A homebrew class for those who channel the untamed forces of nature and the elements, embodying the primal magic of the wild.
info.author: Crimson's Homebrew

description.p: A towering figure clad in dark plate armor strides into battle, wielding a massive runeblade that glows with unholy energy. A ghoul shambles behind them, ready to strike at their command. The air around them grows cold as frost and necrotic energy swirl in their wake.

A Death Knight is a master of death and decay, wielding the power of runes and necrotic energy to devastate their enemies and protect their allies. They are relentless warriors, capable of summoning undead minions, spreading plagues, and unleashing devastating attacks fueled by their unique Rune System.

Whether as a tanky Blood Death Knight, a frost-wielding melee damage dealer, or a necrotic summoner of the Unholy path, Death Knights are versatile and powerful combatants who thrive in the chaos of battle.

Death Knights utilize a unique resource system called the Rune System, which consists of Blood, Frost, and Unholy Runes, as well as Runic Power. These resources fuel their abilities and grow stronger as the Death Knight levels up.

As you build your Death Knight, consider the source of your unholy power. Were you raised by a dark master, or did you willingly embrace the path of undeath? What drives you to wield such power—revenge, duty, or a thirst for destruction?

Your choice of subclass—Blood, Frost, or Unholy—will shape your playstyle. Blood Death Knights excel at tanking and self-healing, Frost Death Knights focus on critical strikes and melee damage, and Unholy Death Knights summon undead minions and spread plagues.
You can make a Death Knight quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Charisma your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the soldier or acolyte background.
As a Death Knight, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d12 per Death Knight level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 12 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d12 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per Death Knight level after 1st
Armor: Light armor, Medium Armor, Heavy armor
Skills: Choose two skills from Arcana, Athletics, Intimidation, Perception, and Survival

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) chain mail or (b) leather armor, longbow, and 20 arrows
(a) a martial weapon or (b) two simple weapons
(a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) two handaxes
(a) a dungeoneer’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

sheet.description: A master of necrotic power and martial combat, wielding runes and unholy energy to devastate foes and command the undead.

setters.set: A master of necrotic power and martial combat, wielding runes and unholy energy to devastate foes and command the undead..
Light armor, medium armor, heavy armor, shields, simple weapons, martial weapons

description.p: The Rune System grants you access to Blood, Frost, and Unholy Runes, which fuel your abilities. You also gain Runic Power, which is generated by using certain abilities and can be spent to empower others.

At 1st level, you gain 1 Blood Rune, 1 Frost Rune, and 1 Unholy Rune. You also have a maximum of 100 Runic Power, which increases as you level up. Weapon attacks have a 15% chance to generate 20 Runic Power.

sheet.description: Grants access to Blood, Frost, and Unholy Runes, as well as Runic Power to fuel abilities. Weapon attacks have a 15% chance to generate 20 Runic Power.

description.p: You can hurl a bolt of necrotic energy at a creature within 60 feet. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. Alternatively, you can restore hit points to a friendly undead.
Damage starts at 1d10 necrotic damage at 1st level, scaling to 2d10 at 5th, 3d10 at 9th, 4d10 at 13th, and 5d10 at 17th, plus your Charisma modifier. Healing follows the same dice progression.
Special (Unholy): 30% chance to generate 1 Unholy Rune upon cast.

sheet.description: Hurl a bolt of necrotic energy at a creature within 60 feet or heal a friendly undead. Damage/healing scales with level. Costs 30 Runic Power.

description.p: You can use your bonus action to pull a creature within 30 feet toward you. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. The target is stunned until the start of your next turn.
You can use this ability once per combat, twice at 11th level, and an unlimited number of times at 17th level.

sheet.description: Pull a creature within 30 feet toward you and stun it until the start of your next turn. Usable once per combat, scaling with level.

description.p: You are immune to all diseases.

sheet.description: You are immune to all diseases.

description.p: You can use your action to summon a Ghoul that acts on your initiative. The Ghoul's AC and HP scale with your proficiency bonus and level. The Ghoul remains for 6 turns, increasing to 10 turns at 13th level.
Special (Unholy): The Ghoul becomes permanent and can be resummoned with a short rest.

sheet.description: Summon a Ghoul for 6 turns (10 at 13th level). Costs 1 Unholy Rune. Special (Unholy): Ghoul becomes permanent.

description.p: You can use your action to reduce a target's movement speed by 100% and apply the Chilled condition for 2 turns. At 11th level, you can affect up to 2 targets; at 17th level, you can affect all creatures in a 15-foot radius.

sheet.description: Reduce a target's movement speed by 100% and apply Chilled for 2 turns. Costs 1 Frost Rune. Affects multiple targets at higher levels.

description.p: You can use your bonus action to sacrifice a friendly undead within 30 feet to heal yourself for 50% of your maximum HP. At 15th level, this increases to 75% of your maximum HP.

sheet.description: Sacrifice a friendly undead to heal yourself for 50% of your max HP (75% at 15th level). Costs 1 Blood Rune.
